item.title:
$TSLA - TESLA Q1 PREVIEW: WELLS FARGO SEES PROFIT DROP
Wells Fargo expects Tesla's Q1 EPS at $0.34, below the $0.42 consensus, citing weak deliveries (~337K units) and low operating leverage. Auto gross margin (ex-credits) is seen falling to 12.8% from 13.6%.
The firm cut its FY25 EPS forecast by 16%, citing an 11% drop in deliveries (vs. 7% prior). Demand for the refreshed Model Y appears soft, with inventory reportedly building. Thereâ€™s also no update on the low-cost Model 2, and Cybertruck demand is fading.
While pricing for Models 3/Y and S/X rose slightly, aggressive financing acts as a stealth discount, failing to boost demand. Analysts expect Tesla to pivot toward speculative projects like the Cybercab and Optimus, though experts remain skeptical.
item.description:
$TSLA - TESLA Q1 PREVIEW: WELLS FARGO SEES PROFIT DROP

Wells Fargo expects Tesla's Q1 EPS at $0.34, below the $0.42 consensus, citing weak deliveries (~337K units) and low operating leverage. Auto gross margin (ex-credits) is seen falling to 12.8% from 13.6%.

The firm cut its FY25 EPS forecast by 16%, citing an 11% drop in deliveries (vs. 7% prior). Demand for the refreshed Model Y appears soft, with inventory reportedly building. Thereâ€™s also no update on the low-cost Model 2, and Cybertruck demand is fading.

While pricing for Models 3/Y and S/X rose slightly, aggressive financing acts as a stealth discount, failing to boost demand. Analysts expect Tesla to pivot toward speculative projects like the Cybercab and Optimus, though experts remain skeptical.

item.title:
GOLD TOPS $3,400 ON WORRIES OVER FED
Gold futures are up over 3%, topping $3,400 per troy ounce for the first time. Driving the surge is President Trump's attacks on Fed Char Jerome Powell, which is driving money toward safe havens like gold. "This is a subject that the markets do not favor, and in our opinion, if Trump escalates his attacks on the Fed chief gold will continue to outperform," says Peter Cardillo of Spartan Capital Securities - pegging his new target for gold prices as 'possibly' $5,000 per troy ounce.
item.description:
GOLD TOPS $3,400 ON WORRIES OVER FED

Gold futures are up over 3%, topping $3,400 per troy ounce for the first time. Driving the surge is President Trump's attacks on Fed Char Jerome Powell, which is driving money toward safe havens like gold. "This is a subject that the markets do not favor, and in our opinion, if Trump escalates his attacks on the Fed chief gold will continue to outperform," says Peter Cardillo of Spartan Capital Securities - pegging his new target for gold prices as 'possibly' $5,000 per troy ounce.
